title: Lesson 1: Tổng quan kỹ năng Speaking TOEIC
prompt: Please introduce yourself in English. Mention your name, where you are from, what you do, and why you want to improve your English speaking skills.

title: Lesson 2: Pronunciation and Intonation
prompt: Read the following sentence aloud and focus on your pronunciation and intonation: 'Learning English helps me connect with people around the world.'

title: Lesson 3: Speaking Fluency and Timing
prompt: Talk about your favorite hobby for 45 seconds. Try to speak naturally without long pauses or repetition.

title: Lesson 4: Reading Aloud – Tone and Pauses
prompt: Read the following text aloud clearly and with natural pauses: 'Good morning everyone. Thank you for coming to our meeting today. Let’s start with our first topic.'

title: Lesson 5: Picture Description – People and Actions
prompt: Look at a picture showing people working in an office. Describe what the people are doing and what you can see in the background.

title: Lesson 6: Picture Description – Places and Objects
prompt: Describe a photo of a park or a café. Mention the objects, the setting, and what kind of atmosphere you think it has.

title: Lesson 7: Short Responses – Daily Topics
prompt: Answer this question: What do you usually do on weekends? Keep your answer short and natural, about 2–3 sentences.

title: Lesson 8: Extended Responses – Giving Details
prompt: Describe your favorite restaurant. Talk about where it is, what food they serve, and why you like it.

title: Lesson 9: Using Opinion and Reasoning
prompt: Do you think it’s better to study alone or in a group? Explain your opinion and give at least one reason.

title: Lesson 10: Giving Suggestions and Solutions
prompt: Your friend wants to improve his English but doesn’t know how to start. Give him some suggestions and explain why they are helpful.

title: Lesson 11: Agreeing and Disagreeing Politely
prompt: Your coworker says that working from home is less effective. Do you agree or disagree? Explain your opinion politely.

title: Lesson 12: Expressing Opinions on Common Issues
prompt: What do you think about using smartphones in class? Give your opinion and one or two reasons.

title: Lesson 13: Common Phrases for TOEIC Speaking
prompt: Use at least three useful phrases for TOEIC Speaking to answer this question: What are the advantages of learning English online?

title: Lesson 14: Speaking Mock Test
prompt: You will be given three short tasks: (1) Describe a picture. (2) Respond to a question about your daily life. (3) Express your opinion on a topic. Try to complete all parts within 2 minutes.

title: Lesson 15: Feedback & Improvement Strategies
prompt: Reflect on your speaking progress. Talk about what skills you have improved and what areas you still need to work on.
